intro: Microstegium boreale, commonly known as the northern wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive white or pale green underside, and it produces small, yellow flowers in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Microstegium boreale is part of the Oxalidaceae family, which is characterized by its calcium oxalate crystals in the leaves. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides food for various insects and small mammals.
